paperTitle: Automatically Generated Summaries of Video Lectures May Enhance Students’ Learning Experience

candidates.title: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners
candidates.reason: Core to P: the paper directly uses GPT-3 (text-davinci-002) and evaluates zero-shot, few-shot prompting, and fine-tuning paradigms derived from Brown et al.; even discusses GPT-3 token limits and prompting sensitivity.

candidates.title: Automatic Summarization of Lecture Slides for Enhanced Student Preview–Technical Report and User Study–
candidates.reason: Direct prior evidence that summaries improve quiz performance and study efficiency; strongly informs P’s hypothesis and user-study design comparing video-only, summary-only, and combined conditions.

candidates.title: News Summarization and Evaluation in the Era of GPT-3
candidates.reason: Motivates using GPT-3 for summarization by showing human preference for GPT-3 news summaries; supports P’s choice of model and feasibility of LLM-based summarization.

candidates.title: Video digests: a browsable
candidates.reason: skimmable format for informational lecture videos, Closest prior on lecture video textual summaries (manual/crowdsourced); P positions its automatic LLM approach against this earlier human-authored paradigm.

candidates.title: Self-regulated learning support in flipped learning videos enhances learning outcomes
candidates.reason: Supports the educational premise that augmenting video lectures improves learning outcomes, aligning with P’s findings that summaries enhance the studying experience.

candidates.title: Data-driven interaction techniques for improving navigation of educational videos
candidates.reason: Background on HCI methods (interactive transcripts, highlights) that improve video learning; P contributes an additional augmentation (automatic summaries) in this lineage.

candidates.title: CatchLive: Real-time Summarization of Live Streams with Stream Content and Interaction Data
candidates.reason: Related work on video summarization (live streams) that contextualizes P within broader video summarization efforts, though P focuses on offline lecture transcripts.

candidates.title: Multitask Prompted Training Enables Zero-Shot Task Generalization
candidates.reason: Cited to substantiate zero/few-shot prompting capabilities of LLMs that P empirically explores; conceptual support rather than direct method.

paperTitle: Automatically Generated Summaries of Video Lectures May Enhance Students’ Learning Experience

candidates.title: Finetuned Language Models Are Zero-Shot Learners
candidates.reason: Supports the idea that instruction/fine-tuned LMs generalize without task-specific training; background for P’s fine-tuning vs prompting comparison.

candidates.title: Cross-Task Generalization via Natural Language Crowdsourcing Instructions
candidates.reason: Further evidence for instruction-driven generalization cited by P; ancillary to P’s core GPT-3 setup.

candidates.title: Universal Language Model Fine-tuning for Text Classification
candidates.reason: General fine-tuning precedent; tangential since P fine-tunes GPT-3 within its own API rather than adopting ULMFiT-style methodology.

candidates.title: PromptSource: An Integrated Development Environment and Repository for Natural Language Prompts
candidates.reason: Broad prompting infrastructure reference; not directly used in P’s experiments and thus least influential.
